meta.title: Microbiology E&D - Mission NEET PG 2.0 - Final Batch - 15-06-2025 - 2025-06-15

questions.text: A patient with a urinary tract infection caused by E. coli shows resistance to third-generation cephalosporins but is sensitive to carbapenems. Which of the following mechanisms most likely explains this resistance?
questions.correct_answer: A. Production of Extended Spectrum Beta-Lactamases
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Production of Extended Spectrum Beta-Lactamases

questions.text: Which of the following antimicrobial susceptibility testing methods directly determines the Minimum Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) by utilizing a predefined, continuous, and stable gradient of an antibiotic immobilized on a plastic strip?
All of the following organisms typically produce a K/A reaction with H₂S on Triple Sugar Iron (TSI) agar except:
A man develops flushing, rash, headache, and diarrhea 20 minutes after eating tuna. What is the most likely cause of his symptoms?

options.label: C
options.text: Histamine released from improperly stored fish

questions.correct_answer: C. Histamine released from improperly stored fish
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Histamine released from improperly stored fish

questions.text: A 28-year-old man visits the clinic for HIV testing after a recent unprotected sexual encounter that occurred 10 days ago. He has no symptoms currently. He is anxious and requests the most reliable test to rule out HIV infection at this stage. Which of the following is the best diagnostic approach at this time?

A patient presents with acute diarrhea after consuming undercooked seafood. A stool sample is sent for culture. Which of the following enrichment media is BEST suited to isolate the suspected pathogen?

A 55-year-old diabetic male presents with high-grade fever, productive cough with blood-tinged sputum, and signs of consolidation in the right upper lobe on chest X-ray. Sputum is thick, mucoid, and described as "currant jelly." Which of the following virulence factors is MOST responsible for this organism's pathogenicity?

A hospitalized 70-year-old male on broad-spectrum antibiotics develops profuse diarrhea. Colonoscopy reveals pseudomembranes. Stool culture grows anaerobic gram-positive bacilli. Which feature best confirms the organism as the cause?

options.label: A
options.text: Detection of heat-labile enterotoxin via ELISA

options.label: B
options.text: Isolation on blood agar under aerobic conditions

options.label: C
options.text: Isolation of bacteria in cell culture

options.label: D
options.text: Identification of spores in stool via Gram stain

questions.correct_answer: A. Detection of heat-labile enterotoxin via ELISA
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Detection of heat-labile enterotoxin via ELISA

questions.text: A 23-year-old male who recently returned from a backpacking trip across rural Africa presents with hematuria and dysuria. On urine microscopy, following image is seen. All of the following features helps differentiate this organism from trematodes except:
questions.correct_answer: C. Man as the definitive host
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Man as the definitive host

questions.text: Which unique structural component of Gram-negative bacterial cell walls is responsible for inducing TNF-α and IL-1 during septic shock?
A patient suspected of secondary syphilis tests negative on VDRL, but TPHA is strongly positive. Repeat VDRL at higher dilution becomes positive. What is the most likely explanation?

options.label: C
options.text: Low antibody levels in early infection

questions.correct_answer: D. Excess antibodies preventing lattice formation
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Excess antibodies preventing lattice formation

questions.text: A 16-year-old boy is brought to the emergency room with high fever, severe headache, vomiting, and altered sensorium. Symptoms started 3 days after swimming in a warm freshwater lake. Gram stain of CSF is negative, but wet mount reveals motile trophozoites. Which of the following is the MOST likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old man is being evaluated for possible acute hepatitis B infection. His lab report shows, HBsAg: Positive, Anti-HBc IgM: Positive & HBeAg: Positive. A medical intern suggests testing for HBcAg in the serum to confirm the diagnosis. As the attending, how would you respond?

options.label: A
options.text: HBcAg is a secreted viral protein and is detectable in serum in acute HBV infection

options.label: B
options.text: HBcAg is not detected in serum as it is bound to neutralizing antibodies

options.label: C
options.text: HBcAg is found only in chronic carriers and not in acute infection

options.label: D
options.text: HBcAg is not detectable in serum because it is intracellular and not secreted

questions.correct_answer: D. HBcAg is not detectable in serum because it is intracellular and not secreted
questions.explanation: Ans. D) HBcAg is not detectable in serum because it is intracellular and not secreted

questions.text: A patient presents with painless genital ulcer and unilateral tender inguinal lymphadenopathy as shown in the picture below. Which of the following is the MOST accurate test to confirm the diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Culture of aspirate on Thayer-Martin media

options.label: D
options.text: Gram stain of lymph node aspirate

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents with diplopia, dry mouth, and progressive descending muscle weakness. He had consumed home-canned green beans 24 hours ago. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of the likely causative agent?

options.label: A
options.text: Inhibits acetylcholine release at the neuromuscular junction

options.label: B
options.text: Blocks GABA release from presynaptic vesicles

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibits acetylcholinesterase, increasing ACh in synapse

options.label: D
options.text: Triggers autoimmune destruction of presynaptic calcium channels

questions.correct_answer: A. Inhibits acetylcholine release at the neuromuscular junction
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Inhibits acetylcholine release at the neuromuscular junction

questions.text: A 30-year-old man is found to have the following Hepatitis B serology on routine screening: HBsAg: Positive Anti-HBe: Positive Anti-HBc IgM: Negative HBV DNA: 200 IU/mL ALT: Normal. What is the most likely interpretation of these results?

options.label: C
options.text: Chronic active hepatitis B with precore mutation

questions.text: Which of the following viruses is not an enveloped virus?

A 28-year-old man returns from a beach vacation in Goa. He presents with an intensely itchy, serpiginous, raised lesion on his foot as shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism?

A 40-year-old man who regularly eats raw freshwater fish presents with fatigue and glossitis. Labs reveal macrocytic anemia with low serum vitamin B12 levels. Which of the following parasites is the most likely cause?

A child presents with bloody diarrhea but no fever. Stool culture on sorbitol MacConkey agar shows colorless colonies, while regular MacConkey shows lactose fermentation. Most likely causative organism is:

A 5-year-old child presents with high fever, diffuse rash, hypotension, and multiorgan involvement following a recent skin infection. Laboratory tests reveal elevated cytokine levels. Which of the following bacterial toxins is most likely responsible for this clinical presentation?

options.label: B
options.text: Toxic shock syndrome toxin-1 (TSST-1) of Staphylococcus aureus

questions.correct_answer: B. Toxic shock syndrome toxin-1 (TSST-1) of Staphylococcus aureus
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Toxic shock syndrome toxin-1 (TSST-1) of Staphylococcus aureus

questions.text: Match the inclusion body with the correct organism:

A lab technician stains a CSF sample from a suspected meningitis patient. Both Neisseria meningitidis and Streptococcus pneumoniae in the sample appear purple under the microscope. Which step in Gram staining was most likely skipped?
Which of the following organisms show this kind of growth?
The vector given below transmits all diseases except:

A 32-year-old man presents with 8 days of high fever, headache, and abdominal discomfort. He had similar symptoms 2 months ago and recovered with antibiotics. On this visit, a Widal test done on Day 8 of fever shows: TO: 1:120 TH: 1:200 AH: 1:360 BH: 1:80 What is the BEST interpretation of these findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Diagnostic of S. Paratyphi A infection

options.label: D
options.text: Indicates acute mixed infection with S. Typhi and S. Paratyphi A

questions.correct_answer: D. Indicates acute mixed infection with S. Typhi and S. Paratyphi A
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Indicates acute mixed infection with S. Typhi and S. Paratyphi A

questions.text: Which of the following organisms is a normal commensal of the vaginal flora, helps maintain acidic pH, and can grow in low pH environments?

A 26-year-old man steps on a rusty nail while working at a construction site. The wound is deep and contaminated with soil. His immunization records show he received his last tetanus toxoid (TT) dose 8 years ago, but has completed primary childhood vaccination. What is the most appropriate next step?

options.label: D
options.text: Administer both tetanus toxoid and tetanus immunoglobulin

questions.text: A 45-year-old male farmer from the Ohio River Valley presents with fever, cough, weight loss, and multiple small skin nodules. Chest X-ray shows diffuse pulmonary infiltrates. A culture on Kelly’s media grew colonies. LPCB mount of the organism shows the following image. Which of the following is TRUE about this infection?

options.label: A
options.text: It is caused by a dimorphic fungus that shows narrow based buddying

options.label: B
options.text: It primarily infects neutrophils, not macrophages

options.label: C
options.text: The infection is transmitted through person-to-person contact

options.label: D
options.text: Treatment is usually with oral fluconazole only

questions.correct_answer: A. It is caused by a dimorphic fungus that shows narrow based buddying
questions.explanation: Ans. A) It is caused by a dimorphic fungus that shows narrow based buddying

questions.text: What is the principle of this test shown?
Papain digestion of an IgG molecule produces which of the following fragments?

options.label: A
options.text: One Fc fragment and two Fab fragments

options.label: B
options.text: One Fab fragment and two Fc fragments

options.label: C
options.text: One Fab2 fragment and one Fc fragment

options.label: D
options.text: Two Fab2 fragments and one Fc fragment

questions.correct_answer: A. One Fc fragment and two Fab fragments
questions.explanation: Ans. A) One Fc fragment and two Fab fragments

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy from rural Bihar presents in August with high-grade fever, headache, altered sensorium, and neck rigidity. CSF shows lymphocytic predominance, normal glucose, mildly elevated protein, and is negative for bacteria and fungi. The life cycle of the organism is shown. What vaccine can be given to prevent this infection?
Which of the following media is selective for isolating Bacillus cereus from food samples by inhibiting competing flora?

A 65-year-old diabetic presents with fever and pus from a chronic foot ulcer. Culture shows Gram-positive cocci in clusters, coagulase positive, mannitol fermenting. Cefoxitin resistance noted. Vancomycin started, but patient does not improve. Which of the following best explains treatment failure?
questions.correct_answer: C. PBP2a and thickened cell wall
questions.explanation: Ans. C) PBP2a and thickened cell wall

questions.text: Match the following:
What are the clinical features caused by the organism shown in the image?

A 28-year-old man presents to the emergency room after being bitten by a stray dog 5 days ago. The bite was deep and located on the face. He has not taken any prior rabies vaccination. On examination, he is alert and asymptomatic. What is the most appropriate next step in management?

options.label: B
options.text: No treatment needed as patient is asymptomatic

options.label: C
options.text: Start anti-rabies vaccine + administer rabies immunoglobulin

questions.correct_answer: C. Start anti-rabies vaccine + administer rabies immunoglobulin
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Start anti-rabies vaccine + administer rabies immunoglobulin

questions.text: Match the following media to its organism.

A 32-year-old sewage worker presents with acute onset of fever, myalgia, conjunctival suffusion, and mild jaundice. He has recently worked barefoot during heavy rainfall. Blood cultures are sterile. Which of the following is considered the gold standard test for confirming the diagnosis of this disease?

A 45-year-old diabetic male presents with greenish-blue wound discharge and a fruity odour from a non-healing foot ulcer. Despite multiple antibiotic courses, the ulcer persists. Which of the following virulence factors is most responsible for tissue damage in this infection?

A child from Bihar presents with prolonged fever and hepatosplenomegaly. Bone marrow aspirate was taken and Giemsa stained was performed. The image of the stain is shown below. What is the vector for this infection?
All the diseases can be caused by Parvovirus B19 except:
What explains the negative rapid test for image of the organism given below?

options.label: B
options.text: Infection with Plasmodium falciparum lacking HRP2 gene

options.label: C
options.text: Plasmodium malariae infection with low parasitaemia

options.label: D
options.text: False negative RDT due to technical error

questions.correct_answer: B. Infection with Plasmodium falciparum lacking HRP2 gene
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Infection with Plasmodium falciparum lacking HRP2 gene

questions.text: A patient presents with profuse, rice-water stools and signs of severe dehydration. Which of the following best describes the initial receptor interaction of this organism causing the above disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Binding to GM1 ganglioside receptor via B subunit of toxin

options.label: B
options.text: Binding to M-cell surface integrins via A subunit of toxin

options.label: C
options.text: Invasion through Peyer's patches using LPS receptor

options.label: D
options.text: Attachment to TLR-4 leading to cytokine-mediated secretion

questions.correct_answer: A. Binding to GM1 ganglioside receptor via B subunit of toxin
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Binding to GM1 ganglioside receptor via B subunit of toxin

questions.text: A 9-year-old child has recurrent episodes of fever, neck stiffness, and purpuric rash. CSF cultures repeatedly grow Neisseria meningitidis. Suspected immunodeficiency is due to a defect in:

A 40-year-old leather worker presents with a painless black eschar on his forearm surrounded by edema. Suspecting cutaneous anthrax, a sample is sent for culture. Which of the following statements about its culture characteristics and media is/are true? 1. It grows on nutrient agar as Medusa head colonies 2. It shows β-hemolysis on blood agar 3. It is non-motile unlike other Bacillus species 4. PLET medium is selective for B. anthracis

A 24-year-old medical student from Mumbai is scheduled for a clinical elective in the USA. She is required to undergo screening for latent tuberculosis before entering the hospital. She has taken BCG vaccine in infancy. She is asymptomatic, and her chest X-ray is normal. All are used to detect latent TB except:

A 60-year-old man with a history of chronic steroid use presents with severe diarrhea, abdominal pain, and cough. Stool exam reveals larvae with a notched tail. Which of the following is ture about this parasite?

options.label: A
options.text: Infection occurs through ingestion of contaminated water

options.label: B
options.text: It has a direct life cycle with no autoinfection

options.label: C
options.text: Hyperinfection syndrome can occur in immunocompromised hosts

options.label: D
options.text: Adult worms reside in the colon and cause ulceration

questions.correct_answer: C. Hyperinfection syndrome can occur in immunocompromised hosts
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Hyperinfection syndrome can occur in immunocompromised hosts

questions.text: A 38-year-old male farmer presents with a slowly progressive, firm swelling over the angle of his jaw. The lesion has multiple sinus tracts discharging thick yellowish pus. Gram stain of the pus reveals gram-positive filamentous organisms. Which of the following best describes the diagnostic hallmark seen in this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Sulfur granules composed of bacterial colonies

options.label: C
options.text: Encapsulated yeast on India ink stain

questions.correct_answer: B. Sulfur granules composed of bacterial colonies
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Sulfur granules composed of bacterial colonies

questions.text: Which of the following correctly matches the pasteurization method with its temperature and time?

A 50-year-old man presents with progressive unsteadiness while walking, mood changes, and recent episodes of urinary incontinence. Neurologic exam reveals a positive Romberg sign, wide-based gait. He mentions having had a painless genital ulcer many years ago that healed without treatment. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step to confirm the diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Serum for Multiplex PCR for Viral panel

questions.text: Match the following:

A pregnant woman returns from Brazil with low-grade fever, rash, conjunctivitis, and joint pain. Her child is born with microcephaly. Which of the following vector is most responsible for transmission in this case?

A hospitalized patient with a urinary catheter develops a multidrug-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae infection. Investigation shows the resistance genes are located on a plasmid, and the same plasmid is later identified in E. coli isolates from another patient in the ICU. Which of the following best explains the spread of resistance in this scenario?
Which of the following is not a feature of MHC class I molecules?
questions.correct_answer: D. Expressed only on dendritic cells
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Expressed only on dendritic cells

questions.text: Which of the following are examples of heterophile antibody-based tests? 1. Paul-Bunnell test 2. Weil-Felix test 3. Cold agglutinin test 4. VDRL test 5. Forssman antigen-based test 6. Widal test
Identify the virus based on its structural image provided:

32-year-old male from an endemic coastal region presents with mild scrotal swelling but no fever or eosinophilia. A midnight blood smear shows the organism in the image. Despite this, the patient’s ICT for filarial antigen is negative. What is the most likely explanation?

options.label: A
options.text: The infection is due to Brugia malayi, not Wuchereria bancrofti

options.label: B
options.text: The smear was taken during the wrong time window for microfilaremia

options.label: C
options.text: The patient has occult filariasis with sequestered adult worms but no circulating antigen

options.label: D
options.text: The ICT test detects only Loa loa, not Wuchereria bancrofti

questions.correct_answer: C. The patient has occult filariasis with sequestered adult worms but no circulating antigen
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The patient has occult filariasis with sequestered adult worms but no circulating antigen

questions.text: A 32-year-old man returns from a camping trip in Himachal Pradesh. He presents with high-grade fever, myalgia, and headache. On examination, he has a black, crusted necrotic lesion with an erythematous halo on his abdomen, and tender regional lymphadenopathy. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism?

A throat swab culture from a child with meningitis shows no growth on blood agar, but when streaked near a Staphylococcus aureus colony, small colonies appear around it. What is the best explanation for this phenomenon?

options.label: C
options.text: CO₂ produced by S. aureus aids growth

options.label: D
options.text: Factor X provided by S. aureus

questions.text: A patient during a routine ANC checkup underwent a torch profile where she came positive for anti- IgM Rubella antibodies. She decided to continue the pregnancy. Six months later the child was born with symptoms suggestive of congenital rubella syndrome. All can be seen in the child except:

A 9-year-old child from a rural area presents with chronic abdominal pain, fatigue, and recent onset of rectal prolapse. Stool examination reveals barrel-shaped eggs with bipolar plugs. Which of the following complications is most strongly associated with this infection?

A 52-year-old man underwent a renal transplant 4 weeks ago and is currently on immunosuppressants. He presents with fever, malaise, and diarrhea. On examination, he is afebrile with mild pallor and no lymphadenopathy. Colonoscopy shows shallow mucosal ulcers, Biopsy shows large cells with basophilic intranuclear inclusions with perinuclear halo. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism?

A 22-year-old college student presents with low-grade fever, persistent dry cough, and malaise for the past 10 days. Chest X-ray shows diffuse interstitial infiltrates. The physician suspects atypical pneumonia. Which of the following best explains why beta-lactams are ineffective in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: The organism has an efflux pump that removes beta-lactams

options.label: B
options.text: The organism has an altered penicillin-binding protein

options.label: D
options.text: The organism lacks a cell wall

questions.correct_answer: D. The organism lacks a cell wall
questions.explanation: Ans. D) The organism lacks a cell wall

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with foul-smelling greenish vaginal discharge, itching, and pain during intercourse. On examination of her cervix shows this image. Which of the following statements are correct about this condition? 1. The organism has no cyst form in its life cycle 2. It is a flagellated protozoan 3. It increases the risk of HIV transmission 4. Metronidazole should be given to the patient and her partner 5. Diagnosis is confirmed by Gram stain
Which of the following scenarios violates Koch’s postulates?

options.label: A
options.text: Treponema pallidum cannot be cultured on artificial media

options.label: B
options.text: A pure culture of Bacillus anthracis causes disease in healthy mice

options.label: C
options.text: Mycobacterium tuberculosis is found in all patients with active pulmonary TB

options.label: D
options.text: The organism isolated from a diseased host is re-isolated from an experimentally infected animal

questions.correct_answer: A. Treponema pallidum cannot be cultured on artificial media
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Treponema pallidum cannot be cultured on artificial media

questions.text: Identify the organism by the image provided:

A 21-year-old previously healthy male presents to the ER with high-grade fever, altered sensorium, neck stiffness, and hypotension. On examination, he is febrile, drowsy, and has petechial rashes over his lower limbs. CSF shows increased pressure, Glucose: (↓), Protein: (↑), WBC count: 90% neutrophils Gram stain of CSF shows this image. Which of the following features is most characteristic of the causative organism?

A 21-year-old male presents with high-grade fever for 4 days, retro-orbital pain, myalgia, and a diffuse maculopapular rash. On Day 5, he develops persistent vomiting, abdominal pain, and restlessness. His hematocrit is rising, and platelet count is 45,000/mm³. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis at this stage?

A 4-year-old child is brought to the clinic with low-grade fever, irritability, and refusal to eat. On examination, there are multiple vesicular lesions on the hands, feet, and in the oral cavity. Which of the following is ture about the likely causative agent?

options.label: A
options.text: It is an enveloped RNA virus of the Picornaviridae family

options.label: B
options.text: The same virus can cause herpangina in older children

options.label: C
options.text: It is transmitted by respiratory droplets only

options.label: D
options.text: It establishes latency in the dorsal root ganglia

questions.correct_answer: B. The same virus can cause herpangina in older children
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The same virus can cause herpangina in older children

questions.text: A 34-year-old HIV-positive man on ART presents with chronic cough, fever, weight loss, and hemoptysis. Sputum GeneXpert shows Mycobacterium tuberculosis with Rifampicin resistance. Further culture and DST (Drug Sensitivity Testing) reveal resistance to Isoniazid, Rifampicin, Levofloxacin, and Amikacin. Which of the following best defines his TB status?

A 28-year-old wrestler presents with ring-shaped lesions over the thighs. KOH mount reveals spiral hyphae and clusters of microconidia. Culture is non-pigmented and rapid-growing. Which additional lab feature, if present, would most reliably confirm the diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Production of red pigment on Sabouraud agar

questions.text: A 19-year-old woman develops hematuria and mild periorbital puffiness one week after recovering from a sore throat. Urine shows red cell casts. Renal biopsy reveals granular deposits of IgG, IgM, and C3 along the glomerular basement membrane and mesangium. Which type of hypersensitivity reaction best explains the underlying pathogenesis?

A 3-year-old child presents with fever, cough, conjunctivitis, and Koplik spots on the buccal mucosa. The virus was identified as a ss negative-sense RNA virus. Which of the following viral proteins is primarily responsible for attachment of this virus to host cells?

A 35-year-old farmer presents with intermittent fever, sweating, malaise, and joint pains for several weeks. Blood culture grows a small, gram-negative coccobacillus that requires CO2 enrichment and is oxidase positive. Which of the following is the most likely organism?
